title: Crashing problem as of Patch 6.20
body:
So i have been looking through the support threads, but i cant seem to fine one that matches what im going through.

The problem i am having is one that seems to happen randomly or at least whatever is causing it isn't causing it to happen every game. The problem happens in the game usually before 5 minutes in (though it has happened after) and has been inconsistent in occurrence.

The game loads just fine, and i manage to get to lane without something happening (most of the time) however after a little while the game screen freezes for a few seconds (2-5) and then both my monitors go to a black screen. during this time i still get game audio and any audio from music i might be playing. my computer stays like this for up to 30 seconds. then the audio cuts and buzzes for a second or two. then my computer restarts.

As i mentioned, i have looked at other threads for similar problems, as such i have disabled the Microsoft "game play" or whatever recorder. Even after doing so this still happens, and this problem has caused me to be demoted from silver 2 to silver 3, and also given me the "leaver buster" 20 minute wait time.

Now this problem has mostly happened in games in Ranked on summoners Rift, in order to both trouble-shoot and remove the 20 minute queue timer i played some games on "Definitely Not Dominion" and had this happen once in the game mode.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled the game 1 time and before doing so used the repair tool about 5 times to try to fix it. 

I am posting this after a few days because i was looking for anything else that might help fix this and also to make sure it wasn't a hardware problem, and the only thing i can guess is possibly a RAM problem, but it doesn't seem like it is, as this is only happening in league. I would like to get this fixed soon if possible because i am trying to get to gold this season.

replies.body:
This definitely sounds like a poor driver or hardware interaction going on. Your RAM may be an issue, but I'm more inclined to believe it has something to do with your video card. I recommend working through our [Bugsplat & Crash guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) as a next step in troubleshooting this.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

Update DirectX: Check
Update Windows: Check
Install .NET framework: Check
Repair corrupt game files: Check
Preform a clean boot: Check
Reset Graphics card software: Check
Change game Settings: Check
Dissable DirectX debug: Check

I talked to some of my friends, and one of them has had something like this before, twice in fact. he has had it where it is both his ram one time and his graphics card another. my only problem is that this never happens on any other game i have, most of which are more graphic intensive and RAM intensive then league is.

so i am only having this problem with league and i am only having it at random during games. i know that its POSSIBLE that its my RAM as my RAM is a bit older but for this to happen only for league and only after patch 6.20 was released and even then only happen at random (not every game) it just seems all too convenient.
I've got the same problem recently.{{champion:9}}
i have been having this problem for a while now. i have come to a final conclusion that it is my graphics card. it might be something for you to look into.

We can take a closer look and investigate further after taking a look at your system logs. I recommend grabbing a set of these logs using our [Hextech tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [support ticket.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

Let me know if you have any questions.
Just a question... because i just realized something in regards to this. is it possible that its because of a VFX from a skin? because i noticed that its happening a lot when i use star guardian jinx
i used the hextech tool. and i sent in the support ticket, still waiting on response.
same thing with me I am currently uninstalling and reinstalling.
